intro: Sphaerostigma minus, commonly known as the small globe bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant has a compact growth habit, with hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
